tool.name: RUSLEAccounts
tool.displayname: Calculate soil loss accounts (RUSLE) using two land use datasets

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Study_area_mask
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the study area mask shapefile. If this is not provided, the study area mask will be derived from the coverage of the Digital Elevation Model (DEM) below.

param.name: Rainfall_erosivity
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the rainfall erosivity raster.

param.name: Digital_Elevation_Model
param.dialogReference:
Specify the path and filename to the DEM raster. This DEM will be used to calculate the LS-factor based on the slope length and steepness [1].

[1] Morgan, R. P. C. (2005) Soil Erosion and Conservation. National Soil Resources Institute, Cranfield University.

param.name: Kfactor_option
param.expression: Use the Harmonized World Soils Database (FAO) | Use local K-factor dataset
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options fordetermining K-factor depending on the dataset that will be entered in the parameter K-factor: Soils or erodibility dataset below:

  • Use the Harmonized World Soils Database (FAO): Choose this option if the soil dataset below was clipped from the HSWD global dataset.

  • Use local K-factor dataset: Choose this option if using a pre-existing K-factor dataset for this study area.

param.name: Soils
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the raster or shapefile for either the HWSD dataset or the pre-existing K-factor dataset.

param.name: Soil_linking_code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input HWSD or K-factor dataset. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Cfactor_option_A
param.displayname: C-factor for Year A: Land cover option
param.expression: Use the ESA CCI | Use local C-factor dataset
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options for determining C-factor depending on the dataset that will be entered in the parameter C-factorfor Year A: Land cover or cover factor dataset below:

  • Use the ESA CCI: Choose this option if the soil dataset below was clipped from the ESA CCI global dataset.

  • Use local C-factor dataset: Choose this option if using a pre-existing C-factor dataset for this study area.

param.name: Land_cover_A
param.displayname: C-factor for Year A: Land cover or cover factor dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the raster or shapefile for either the ESA CCI dataset or the pre-existing C-factor datasetfor the opening year.

param.name: Land_cover_linking_code_A
param.displayname: C-factor for Year A: Land cover linking code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input land cover or cover factor dataset for the opening year. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_A
param.displayname: P-factor for Year A: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) raster for the opening year.

param.name: Cfactor_option_B
param.displayname: C-factor for Year B: Land cover option
param.expression: Use the ESA CCI | Use local C-factor dataset
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options for determining C-factor depending on the dataset that will be entered in the parameter C-factorfor Year B: Land cover or cover factor dataset below:

  • Use the ESA CCI: Choose this option if the soil dataset below was clipped from the ESA CCI global dataset.

  • Use local C-factor dataset: Choose this option if using a pre-existing C-factor dataset for this study area.

param.name: Land_cover_B
param.displayname: C-factor for Year B: Land cover or cover factor dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the raster or shapefile for either the ESA CCI dataset or the pre-existing C-factor dataset for the closing year.

param.name: Land_cover_linking_code_B
param.displayname: C-factor for Year B: Land cover linking code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input land cover or cover factor dataset for the closing year. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_B
param.displayname: P-factor for Year B: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) raster for the closing year.

tool.summary:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) [1] using two different land cover datasets (e.g. for different time periods) and then compares the difference in soil loss between the opening and closing years. This tool requires the following datasets:

  • Digital Elevation Model

  • Soil: Harmonized World Soils Database

  • Land Cover: Land Cover CCI Climate Research Package

  • Rainfall erosivity: Global Rainfall Erosivity

Instructions for which datasets to download and how to acquire them can be found here.

This tool also allows the user to input their own datasets for soil erodibility (K-factor) and cover (C-factor) if available or they have made their own parameterisation with their soil or land cover data. If the user has made a P-factor dataset for their study area, it can be input in the optional parameters P-factor: support practice dataset for the opening and closing years.

[1] Renard, K., Foster, G., Weesies, G., McCool, D., & Yoder, D. (1997). Predicting soil erosion by water: a guide to conservation planning with the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE). In Agricultural Handbook No. 703.

idCitation.resTitle: Calculate soil loss accounts (RUSLE) using two land use datasets

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) [1] using two different land cover datasets (e.g. for different time periods) and then compares the difference in soil loss between the opening and closing years. This tool requires the following datasets:

  • Digital Elevation Model

  • Soil: Harmonized World Soils Database

  • Land Cover: Land Cover CCI Climate Research Package

  • Rainfall erosivity: Global Rainfall Erosivity

Instructions for which datasets to download and how to acquire them can be found here.

This tool also allows the user to input their own datasets for soil erodibility (K-factor) and cover (C-factor) if available or they have made their own parameterisation with their soil or land cover data. If the user has made a P-factor dataset for their study area, it can be input in the optional parameters P-factor: support practice dataset for the opening and closing years.

[1] Renard, K., Foster, G., Weesies, G., McCool, D., & Yoder, D. (1997). Predicting soil erosion by water: a guide to conservation planning with the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE). In Agricultural Handbook No. 703.
